Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the Democrat plan on Medicare and Medicare Advantage, stating that it would "obliterate" and "terminate" them.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that the Democrat plan would destroy Medicare and leave seniors without care.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all Democrats support the most aggressive plan, Medicare for All, which is not the case.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations and proposals for expanding healthcare coverage, including Medicare for All, but it is not the only option supported by Democrats.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Republican claim of Democrats voting to end Medicare in 2011 was deemed the "Lie of the Year."
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the claim.
